To determine how species richness in different building areas was influenced by paving materials, and which materials mainly characterized each type of building area, a non-parametric multi-dimensional scaling (NMDS) was performed (software R, package Vegan
26 ). Manhattan distance was used for computation, convergence was reached after 100 iterations and the stress of the optimal solutions was 0.0397. To analyse the distribution of species according to their presence or absence in different urban building areas, a PCA analysis was performed. The G-test (software R, package DescTools
27 ) was used to evaluate significant differences between the two datasets with regard to EVIs, life forms, main botanical families and chorotypes. Graphic elaborations were carried out using Microsoft Excel and R software (R Core Team, Vienna, Austria).
